hints.content:
On a clock there are two hands. The $\redD{\text{hour hand}}$ is the shorter hand.  The $\blueE{\text{minute hand}}$ is the longer hand.

![A clock shows the short hour hand points to 5. The long minute hand points to 12.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/45a764740b107b33cf6707c08fe70c7abdbda8c9)

So, $\redD{10}{:}{00} $ looks like this:

![A clock shows the short hour hand points to 10. The long minute hand points to 12. Labels outside the edge of the clock are number 1 through 12.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1b4749dd7ccf9413e0f7b25dcae262b26cbfcec8)

$\redD{10}{:}{\blueE{25}}$ is $\blueE{25}$ ticks from $\redD{10}{:}{00}.$

![A clock shows the short hour hand is between 10 and 11. The long minute hand points to 5. Outside the edge of the clock 12 is labeled 0, 1 is labeled 5, 2 is labeled 10, and so on with 11 labeled 55.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/bb0034cc5a47e76b36a3e0f747f1ca554cf13072)

Notice the hour hand is past $10{:}00$ but not quite to $11{:}00$.

This clock shows $10{:}{25}$.

![A clock shows the short hour hand is between 10 and 11. The long minute hand points to 5.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1a5153bd8f046ef7ccf00d826566c9d429546455)

choices.content: ![A clock shows the short hour hand is between 10 and 11. The long minute hand points to 5.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1a5153bd8f046ef7ccf00d826566c9d429546455)
![A clock shows the short hour hand is between 10 and 11. The long minute hand points to 4.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a9d068d82b9a04b66917e1b5a700397b513352f4)
![A clock shows the short hour hand is between 9 and 10. The long minute hand points to 5.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3159ce3bfd99d4c5695b085020e50f049c7a07ed)
